intro: Amsinckia swainiae, commonly known as the Swain's fiddleneck, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky soils. It produces yellow flowers with a distinctive shape resembling a fiddle, hence its common name. Amsinckia swainiae is adapted to arid environments and is often found in disturbed or sandy soils.
